isis.stitle: NEWAY AD-123/246 DRIVE AXLE AIR SUSPENSIONS - REPLACE - BUSHINGS - EQUALIZING BEAM

svcproc.title: BUSHINGS - EQUALIZING BEAM
svcproc.para: The rubber bushings in the equalizing beam may be replaced using a hydraulic press with a capacity of 10,000 lbs. or greater.
To replace the bushings in an equalizing beam ( Figure 7), first remove the beam from the vehicle.

step1.para: It is recommended the vehicle be unloaded. Block vehicle to prevent rolling. Raise vehicle frame 2 inches (51mm) above air spring height and support with adequate jack stands ( Figure 8). Height control valve may be used to raise vehicle.

warning.para: Jack stands must be of sufficient strength to support the vehicle.

step2.para: Height control valve - disconnect link at lower connection, then rotate control arm to exhaust (approximately 45° down) position. Drain all air from reservoir.
Disconnect air supply line from air spring.

step1.para: Disconnect shock absorbers and air springs at lower end.
Disconnect transverse beam (if it does not come off easily, place a porta-power between the axle and transverse beam), axle connection and pivot connection.
Support the beam. Press out old bushings with a hydraulic press.

caution.para: The beam support fixture must be securely mounted to the hydraulic press.

step1.para: Clean out bushing receptacles in beam of all foreign material before pressing new bushings into the beam.
Lubricate new replacement bushing with an approved rubber lubricant or a soap and water solution.

note.para: Do not use an oil-based lubrication or brake fluid as it can cause damage to the rubber.

step1.para: With the beam supported, press the new bushing into the beam.
Inspect all parts for wear, cracks or field welds. Repair or replace.

caution.para: Do not repair a cracked equalizing beam, replace it.

step1.para: Bushings are to be centered in the equalizing beam ( Figure 9).
Reassemble new or rebushed equalizing beam to frame bracket.
Reassemble axle connection and the transverse beam.
Reconnect air springs, shock absorbers, height control valve linkage.
Re-install, if necessary, wheels, camshafts and tires. Remove jack stands, and build air reservoir pressure in excess of 65 psi. Check RIDE HEIGHT CAPACITY CHART for proper air spring height.

caution.para: 100 psi is maximum allowable operating air system pressure.
